avalancheActivity.comment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions large wind slabs formed.
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant and generally above the tree line.
As a consequence of warming during the day more medium-sized to large gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2500 m, in particular in case of releases originating from starting zones that still retain some snow, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
At intermediate and high altitudes a very large amount of snow is lying.
In isolated cases new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days further medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as above the tree line rather small wind slabs formed. These can be released even by a single winter sport participant at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day more medium-sized to large moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep starting zones that still retain some snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released above the tree line. Natural moist avalanches are still possible. Caution is to be exercised in particular below very steep starting zones that still retain some snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
A lot of snow is lying in all altitude zones. As a consequence of snowfall and the wind, fresh snow drift accumulations formed. The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days medium-sized to large avalanches were observed. The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night and will already soften in the late morning.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions further wind slabs formed. They can be released even by a single winter sport participant at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m. In particular in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation more medium-sized and large avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days can still be released above the tree line. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to gradual moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night will soften earlier than the day before.
In some places new snow is lying on a hard crust. Individual weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
In the last few days medium-sized to large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as in high Alpine regions large wind slabs formed.
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant and generally above the tree line.
As a consequence of warming during the day medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2500 m, in particular in case of releases originating from starting zones that still retain some snow, caution is to be exercised in particular at the base of rock walls, as well as on extremely steep sunny slopes.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
At intermediate and high altitudes a lot of snow is lying for the time of year.
In isolated cases new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days further medium-sized to large avalanches were observed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain mostly shallow wind slabs formed. These can be released, especially by large additional loads, at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible below approximately 2400 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of warming during the day the prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Natural moist avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
A lot of snow is lying in all altitude zones. The new snow of the weekend has settled to a large extent in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will soften earlier than the day before. The high temperatures in the late morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In the last two days small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.
